comments.body: I see you've added the isFirst check in two places.  Does this test cover both (assuming your goal was to test both)?
Nope.  The first one (in the Route base class) is really more documentation that code.  We don't have any non-abstract Route subclasses that don't override that method.
What I meant was a test that actually verified that the Text of, say, an AppBar widget, or of a FlatButton, actually grew.

Well, but shouldn't that be tested by a different test?  Seems like as long as the textScaleFactor changes in the media query, then this code has done its job.  Looks like the MediaQuery and Text/AppBar/FlatButton tests don't really do that kind of testing, however.  I'll see if I can add something there.

I don't mind how many tests you write or how you split it up. :-)

Until now we've not done anything with textScaleFactor, so it's completely untested. We should verify that widgets get bigger when the font is scaled. We can test this as one end-to-end test or many tests that check each link in the chain, either way is fine by me.
Turns out that this is a bug in the way the default font size is handled. I fixed it and added some more tests.

Can you add more fallback behavior tests? e.g. light is used when window is dark and darkTheme is not supplied, light theme is not supplied, changing from a darkTheme to a light window still works because it fallbacks to ThemeData.fallback etc?

Let's expand this test a little: 
assert that buildCount is already 1 after pumpWidget. lets also add something to the tree that will rebuild due to the metrics change and assert that it does.
Done. I also triggered each event once, instead of just the size event.
